questiontext.text: You are seeing a patient who has been exposed to a medication. You look it up in the register of pregnancy medications. It is listed as category C. The patient asks you what this means. Which of the following is your best response?

answer.text: The drug has been evaluated in well-controlled human studies and no fetal risk has been shown.
Animal studies have not shown any fetal risk, or suggested some risk not confirmed in humans, or there are not adequate studies in women.

Animal studies have shown adverse effects, but there are no adequately controlled studies in

humans.
There are some fetal risks, but benefits may outweigh risks under certain circumstances; thus, patients should be warned.
Fetal abnormalities have occurred in animal and human studies, the risk is greater than the benefit, and the drug is contraindicated in pregnancy.

questiontext.text: A 22-year-old woman and her husband are being counseled after a first-trimester miscarriage. She has no significant medical problems. Her physical examination is unremarkable and in counseling her you explain in lay terms that the most likely cause of her miscarriage is aneu-ploidy. Which of the following is the most common aneuploidy causing miscarriage?
Which of the following is the most common complication of full anticoagulation with low-molecularweight heparin?
A woman with a severe ankle sprain was prescribed ibuprofen for 72 hours. At what gestational age should she avoid this medication?
During pregnancy, what is the safest analgesic with the least fetal affect?

The placenta is supplied by two umbilical arteries that carry deoxygenated fetal blood. This blood flows into intervillous capillaries and back to the fetus in the single umbilical vein. The maternal circulation is designed to bathe the placental villi to optimize transport across the placenta of nutrients, oxygen, and metabolic wastes. Which of the following best describes the path of the maternal blood flow?

A chronic hypertensive patient presents with complaints of decreased fetal movement. Her prenatal care has been sporadic but it appears that she is at 37 weeks’ gestation with an estimated fetal weight of 2,200 g. Concerns are raised regarding placental reserves for oxygenating the fetus. This can be most directly assessed by which of the following?
In the fetus, the most well-oxygenated blood is allowed into the systemic circulation by which of the following?
An abnormal biophysical profile (BPP) predicts which of the following?

answer.text: higher risk for antepartum death within 1 week
a baby that will be small for gestational age (SGA)

questiontext.text: A patient and her husband are extremely anxious about your suggestion that she be given magnesium sulfate for seizure prophylaxis. In assuring her about the safety of the drug, you can emphasize which of the following?

answer.text: The drug is rapidly excreted via the kidney.
It is a mild smooth-muscle constrictor and thus safe for the infusion.
The drug has a narrow margin of safety so that we start off with a lower dose in preeclamptics, and administer it by an IV pump.
As a central nervous system (CNS) stimulant it should not deprive her of the awareness of her delivery, unlike barbiturates.
The drug does not cross the placenta and thus should not affect her fetus/infant.

questiontext.text: What malformation should be ( in most cases) detected at 11-14 weeks US examination :
In a patient at 22 weeks, you do not succeed in producing an appropriate 4 chambers view. What is the appropriate management :

answer.text: Do not report any particular finding and ask the pediatrician to check after birth.
Refer the patient to a more senior sonographer

questiontext.text: According to ISUOG guideline, Which of the following item should be routinely assessed in the mid trimester ?
Which of the following antiseizure medication, when taken as monotherapy, is associated with the highest of major congenital malformation ?
Which of the following can be expected following preconceptional counseling, and its implemantion in women with pregestational diabetes ?

answer.text: improved ultrasound scanning in second trimester of pregnancy

questiontext.text: Concerning middle cerebral artery Doppler velocimetry, which of the following is true ?

answer.text: It is usefull for detection and management of fetal anemia of any causes
It superior to modified biophysycal profile in forcasting pregnancy outcome
In those with brain sparing, decreased bllod flow from for reduced cerevrovascular impedance is detected
it was found tobe inferior to amniocentesis and amniotic fluid spectral analysis for predicting fetal anemia
high resisteance patterns are associaed with bad fetal outcomes

questiontext.text: Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. 1. Pemeriksaan penunjang apakah yang paling tepat untuk menegakkan diagnosis kasus ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Apakah etiologi penyebab kasus ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. 4. Apakah antibiotik paling tepat untuk pasien ini?

Perempuan, 22 tahun, G1P0A0, usia kehamilan 36-37 minggu, datang ke Puskesmas dengan keluhan demam, sakit kepala dan malaise. Riwayat luka di vagina sejak 6 minggu lalu, tidak nyeri. Pemeriksaan fisik : ruam kulit papula-skuomosa di telapak tangan dan telapak kaki, papul mengalami ulkus dengan dasar ulkus bersih di vagina, teraba pembesaran kelenjar inguinal bilateral. Apakah komplikasi paling mungkin untuk bayi pada kasus ini?

Perempuan, 29 tahun, G1P0A0, dengan usia kehamilan 12 minggu datang ke Klinik dengan keluhan demam disertai ruam makulopapuler dimulai dari wajah kemudian ke seluruh tubuh dan anggota gerak. Hasil pemeriksaan antibodi IgM Rubella positif. Apakah penatalaksanaan awal pada kasus ini?

Perempuan, 29 tahun, G1P0A0, dengan usia kehamilan 12 minggu datang ke Klinik dengan keluhan demam disertai ruam makulopapuler dimulai dari wajah kemudian ke seluruh tubuh dan anggota gerak. Hasil pemeriksaan antibodi IgM Rubella positif. Komplikasi jangka panjang apakah yang dapat terjadi pada janin dari ibu ini?

Rujukan dari RS B, Umur: 28 th , G1P0A0 gravid 30 minggu His: (-) Pelepasan darah lendir (-) TTV TD: 160/90mmHg N: 155x/menit S: 36,2°C P: 28x/menit Sp02: 73%, tidak dilakukan VT. Hasil primary survey

answer.text: ABC, gawat napas e.c desaturasi, takikarida, hipertensi
Primary survey, gawat napas e.c. desaturasi, hipertensi

questiontext.text: Rujukan dari RS B, Umur: 28 th , G1P0A0 gravid 30 minggu His: (-) Pelepasan darah lendir (-) TTV TD: 160/90mmHg N: 155x/menit S: 36,2°C P: 28x/menit Sp02: 73%, tidak dilakukan VT. Tindakan yang paling awal dilakukan

Rujukan dari RS B, Umur: 28 th , G1P0A0 gravid 30 minggu His: (-) Pelepasan darah lendir (-) TTV TD: 160/90mmHg N: 155x/menit S: 36,2°C P: 28x/menit Sp02: 73%, tidak dilakukan VT. Pilihan tindakan yang tepat

answer.text: Tergantung respon kondisi ibu setelah resusitasi oksigen, seksio sesar langsung juga menyebabkan peningkatan sitokin pro-inflamasi
Langsung Cito SC, karena kegawatan ibu, survival bayi 30 minggu cukup baik. Keadaan desaturasi membuat hipoksemia janin

questiontext.text: Rujukan dari RS B, Umur: 28 th , G1P0A0 gravid 30 minggu His: (-) Pelepasan darah lendir (-) TTV TD: 160/90mmHg N: 155x/menit S: 36,2°C P: 28x/menit Sp02: 73%, tidak dilakukan VT. Tindakan anestesi yang paling tepat untuk kasus ini bila dilakukan operasi
Terapi profilaksis anti koagulan pada kasus covid diberikan dengan pertimbangan:

answer.text: Low molecular weight heparin 40 mg per hari untuk yang belum melahirkan dalam waktu dekat
pemberian antikoagulan pada derajat  ringan, tergantung kadar d-dimer
Untuk profilaksis antepartum yg tidak termasuk berat atau kritikal yang akan melahirkan dalam beberapa hari dapat diberikan unfractionated heparin 5000 units subkutan setiap 12 jam.
Semua pasien inpartu mempunyai potensi terjadi hiperkoagulasi. Harus diberikan antikoagulan

questiontext.text: Which of the following findings are considered diagnostics for overt diabetes in pregnancy?

answer.text: Fasting plasma glucose <font face="Symbol">at least or more than </font>120 mg/dl
Random plasma glucose at least or more than 200 mg/dl

questiontext.text: 2. Which of the following statement is true regarding the management of women with gestational diabetes mellitus?

answer.text: Women with diet-controlled GDM should be monitored with weekly laboratory glucose determinations
Self-blood glucose monitoring regimens should include postprandial determinations
Metformin therapy is recommended as adjunctive therapy for women with severe insulin resistance
The recommended dietary composition includes 20% protein, 50% carbohydrate and 30% fat

questiontext.text: 3. Threshold values of International Association of Diabetes and Pregnancy Study Group Consensus Panel for diagnosis of gestational diabetes mellitus

answer.text: Fasting plasma glucose 92 mg/dl or 5.1 mmol/L

questiontext.text: What is the single most reliable sign of fetal compomise ?
A 25 year old nulliparous patient with HIV wishes to become pregnant. Which of the following is true?

answer.text: Even with appropriate antiretroviral therapy, neonatal infection occurs 20-25% of the time.
With appropriate antiretroviral therapy, breastfeeding is safe in these patients.
the couple, particularly the women, fully understand the risks and consequences of pregnancy, childbirth and child care as well as the agreement / consent of the family

questiontext.text: A pregnant woman with G2P1 at 14 weeks of gestation, post-cesarean section 2 years ago, with laboratory tests for blood type A rhesus negative and her husband's blood type B Rhesus positive. The right treatment for this case is

answer.text: immediately give  anti-D immunoglobulin
Give anti Dimmunoglobulin at gestational age at 20-28 weeks

Give anti D immunoglobulin at 28-34 weeks

 

 weeks
Give anti D immunoglobulin during labor
Postpone anti-D immunoglobulin until the baby is born and the rhesus type is confirmed

questiontext.text: Monoamniotic, dichorionic placentae

Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Berdasarkan penggolongan faktor risiko, pasien ini masuk dalam kategori apa?

Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Kapan dilakukan skrining Diabetes Mellitus pada kasus ini?

Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Ibu bertanya tentang risiko kematian janin pada penderita Diabetes. Penjelasan apakah yang dapat diberikan kepada pasien?

answer.text: Resistensi insulin menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Placental lactogen menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Hiperglikemia menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Progesteron menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat
Hiperplasia sel β pankreas janin menghambat sinstesis surfaktan janin sehingga pematangan paru janin terlambat

questiontext.text: Seorang perempuan, 25 tahun, G1P0A0, terlambat haid 2 minggu dengan hasil uji kehamilan urin positif, datang ke poliklinik untuk pemeriksaan kehamilan pertama. Kedua orangtua pasien menderita hipertensi dan diabetes mellitus, dan saudara perempuan pasien mengalami kematian bayi setelah satu hari kelahiran. Saat ini ibu tidak ada keluhan dan cemas dengan kehamilannya. Pemeriksaan tanda fisik: tanda vital dalam batas normal, tinggi fundus uteri belum teraba. Pemeriksaan apakah yang perlu dilakukan pada pasien ini?

A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. Based on the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommendation statement, which one of the following statements about the diagnosis of pre- eclampsia in this patient is accurate?

answer.text: You should use a validated risk prediction tool, such as the uterine artery pulsatility index, to diagnose preeclampsia.
You can diagnose preeclampsia only after re- peated elevated blood pressure measurements combined with certain associated signs, symp- toms, or laboratory results.
You can diagnose preeclampsia only after the detection of elevated urine protein.
You cannot diagnose preeclampsia yet because the patient’s gestational age is less than 24 weeks.
You should confirm the diagnosis of preeclamp- sia immediately by taking another blood pressure measurement in the upper arm with the patient in the left lateral position.

questiontext.text: A 28-year-old white woman comes to your clinic for prenatal care reporting a new-onset severe headache. She is currently pregnant with twins at an estimated gestational age of 22 weeks. Her obstetric history is significant for one previous term singleton vaginal delivery at 24 years of age without complications; she has had no other pregnan- cies. You use a manual sphygmomanometer on her left arm while she is seated and find that her blood pressure is 154/86 mm Hg. She has no history of elevated blood pressure, and her body mass index is 24 kg per m2. You take another blood pressure measurement during the same visit using appropriate technique and find that it has decreased to 118/74 mm Hg. She has no protein in her urine. Which of the following are the most appropriate next steps for this patient?

answer.text: Recommend that she take daily low-dose aspirin to decrease the risk of preeclampsia, preterm birth, and intrauterine growth restriction.
At subsequent prenatal visits, screen for pre- eclampsia with urine protein testing, not blood pressure measurement.
No need to monitor her blood pressure at every prenatal visit.
Prescribe an antihypertensive medication to decrease her blood pressure.

questiontext.text: Which is true of Hepatitis B in pregnancy?

answer.text: Breastfeeding is always contraindicated in women who are chronic carriers of HBV.
Non-immune mothers should not be vaccinated after the second trimester.
The risk of fetal infection is higher if maternal infection occurs in the third trimester.
Only infants with HBV positive mothers should be vaccinated.

questiontext.text: How is the fetal heart rate baseline determined ?

answer.text: minimun duration needed in a 10-minute period is 5 minutes

questiontext.text: Which of the following are descriptive characteristics of the fetal baseline heart rate
Your patient has microcytic anemia with a haemoglobin of 9 and normal iron stores. What is the most likely diagnosis ?
Anastomosis pembuluh darah plasenta pada TTTS
How do circulating TSH levels change during pregnancy?
The components of a biophysical profile include all except which of the following ?

A 19 year old primigravida comes into triage at 34 wks gestation with premature rupture of membranes, and no uterine contraction since more than 6 hours ago. She has received limited prenatal care. What should your next step be?

answer.text: Rectovaginal  swab and culture, and prophylactic penicillin or erythromycin
CS to avoid exposing the fetus to unknown vaginal flora
IV Clindamycin 9mg every 8 hours until delivery
GBS status does not play a role at this time
Because no history of GBS status, metronidzole is the right choice

questiontext.text: A 30-year-old G3P2 presents for prenatal care. Her prior pregnancies have both been complicated by mild gestational hypertension near term. She is currently 12 weeks pregnant, and her blood pressure is 146/88 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in her management?

A 25 year old patient tell her doctor that she wants to have a child in the next few year. She is concerned as she has seizure disorder and taken valproic acid. It has been 1 year since her last seizure and she has heard that seizures are dangerous for the fetus. 2. Which of the following antiseizure medication, when taken as monotherapy, is associated with the highest of major congenital malformation ?
